1 'use strict';
  2 var _ = require('underscore');
  3 
  4 module.exports = function(AV) {
  5 
  6   /**
  7    * @class
  8    * A AV.Op is an atomic operation that can be applied to a field in a
  9    * AV.Object. For example, calling <code>object.set("foo", "bar")</code>
 10    * is an example of a AV.Op.Set. Calling <code>object.unset("foo")</code>
 11    * is a AV.Op.Unset. These operations are stored in a AV.Object and
 12    * sent to the server as part of <code>object.save()</code> operations.
 13    * Instances of AV.Op should be immutable.
 14    *
 15    * You should not create subclasses of AV.Op or instantiate AV.Op
 16    * directly.
 17    */
 18   AV.Op = function() {
 19     this._initialize.apply(this, arguments);
 20   };
 21 
 22   AV.Op.prototype = {
 23     _initialize: function() {}
 24   };
 25 
 26   _.extend(AV.Op, {
 27     /**
 28      * To create a new Op, call AV.Op._extend();
 29      */
 30     _extend: AV._extend,
 31 
 32     // A map of __op string to decoder function.
 33     _opDecoderMap: {},
 34 
 35     /**
 36      * Registers a function to convert a json object with an __op field into an
 37      * instance of a subclass of AV.Op.
 38      */
 39     _registerDecoder: function(opName, decoder) {
 40       AV.Op._opDecoderMap[opName] = decoder;
 41     },
 42 
 43     /**
 44      * Converts a json object into an instance of a subclass of AV.Op.
 45      */
 46     _decode: function(json) {
 47       var decoder = AV.Op._opDecoderMap[json.__op];
 48       if (decoder) {
 49         return decoder(json);
 50       } else {
 51         return undefined;
 52       }
 53     }
 54   });
 55 
 56   /*
 57    * Add a handler for Batch ops.
 58    */
 59   AV.Op._registerDecoder("Batch", function(json) {
 60     var op = null;
 61     AV._arrayEach(json.ops, function(nextOp) {
 62       nextOp = AV.Op._decode(nextOp);
 63       op = nextOp._mergeWithPrevious(op);
 64     });
 65     return op;
 66   });
 67 
 68   /**
 69    * @class
 70    * A Set operation indicates that either the field was changed using
 71    * AV.Object.set, or it is a mutable container that was detected as being
 72    * changed.
 73    */
 74   AV.Op.Set = AV.Op._extend(/** @lends AV.Op.Set.prototype */ {
 75     _initialize: function(value) {
 76       this._value = value;
 77     },
 78 
 79     /**
 80      * Returns the new value of this field after the set.
 81      */
 82     value: function() {
 83       return this._value;
 84     },
 85 
 86     /**
 87      * Returns a JSON version of the operation suitable for sending to AV.
 88      * @return {Object}
 89      */
 90     toJSON: function() {
 91       return AV._encode(this.value());
 92     },
 93 
 94     _mergeWithPrevious: function(previous) {
 95       return this;
 96     },
 97 
 98     _estimate: function(oldValue) {
 99       return this.value();
100     }
101   });
102 
103   /**
104    * A sentinel value that is returned by AV.Op.Unset._estimate to
105    * indicate the field should be deleted. Basically, if you find _UNSET as a
106    * value in your object, you should remove that key.
107    */
108   AV.Op._UNSET = {};
109 
110   /**
111    * @class
112    * An Unset operation indicates that this field has been deleted from the
113    * object.
114    */
115   AV.Op.Unset = AV.Op._extend(/** @lends AV.Op.Unset.prototype */ {
116     /**
117      * Returns a JSON version of the operation suitable for sending to AV.
118      * @return {Object}
119      */
120     toJSON: function() {
121       return { __op: "Delete" };
122     },
123 
124     _mergeWithPrevious: function(previous) {
125       return this;
126     },
127 
128     _estimate: function(oldValue) {
129       return AV.Op._UNSET;
130     }
131   });
132 
133   AV.Op._registerDecoder("Delete", function(json) {
134     return new AV.Op.Unset();
135   });
136 
137   /**
138    * @class
139    * An Increment is an atomic operation where the numeric value for the field
140    * will be increased by a given amount.
141    */
142   AV.Op.Increment = AV.Op._extend(
143       /** @lends AV.Op.Increment.prototype */ {
144 
145     _initialize: function(amount) {
146       this._amount = amount;
147     },
148 
149     /**
150      * Returns the amount to increment by.
151      * @return {Number} the amount to increment by.
152      */
153     amount: function() {
154       return this._amount;
155     },
156 
157     /**
158      * Returns a JSON version of the operation suitable for sending to AV.
159      * @return {Object}
160      */
161     toJSON: function() {
162       return { __op: "Increment", amount: this._amount };
163     },
164 
165     _mergeWithPrevious: function(previous) {
166       if (!previous) {
167         return this;
168       } else if (previous instanceof AV.Op.Unset) {
169         return new AV.Op.Set(this.amount());
170       } else if (previous instanceof AV.Op.Set) {
171         return new AV.Op.Set(previous.value() + this.amount());
172       } else if (previous instanceof AV.Op.Increment) {
173         return new AV.Op.Increment(this.amount() + previous.amount());
174       } else {
175         throw "Op is invalid after previous op.";
176       }
177     },
178 
179     _estimate: function(oldValue) {
180       if (!oldValue) {
181         return this.amount();
182       }
183       return oldValue + this.amount();
184     }
185   });
186 
187   AV.Op._registerDecoder("Increment", function(json) {
188     return new AV.Op.Increment(json.amount);
189   });
190 
191   /**
192    * @class
193    * Add is an atomic operation where the given objects will be appended to the
194    * array that is stored in this field.
195    */
196   AV.Op.Add = AV.Op._extend(/** @lends AV.Op.Add.prototype */ {
197     _initialize: function(objects) {
198       this._objects = objects;
199     },
200 
201     /**
202      * Returns the objects to be added to the array.
203      * @return {Array} The objects to be added to the array.
204      */
205     objects: function() {
206       return this._objects;
207     },
208 
209     /**
210      * Returns a JSON version of the operation suitable for sending to AV.
211      * @return {Object}
212      */
213     toJSON: function() {
214       return { __op: "Add", objects: AV._encode(this.objects()) };
215     },
216 
217     _mergeWithPrevious: function(previous) {
218       if (!previous) {
219         return this;
220       } else if (previous instanceof AV.Op.Unset) {
221         return new AV.Op.Set(this.objects());
222       } else if (previous instanceof AV.Op.Set) {
223         return new AV.Op.Set(this._estimate(previous.value()));
224       } else if (previous instanceof AV.Op.Add) {
225         return new AV.Op.Add(previous.objects().concat(this.objects()));
226       } else {
227         throw "Op is invalid after previous op.";
228       }
229     },
230 
231     _estimate: function(oldValue) {
232       if (!oldValue) {
233         return _.clone(this.objects());
234       } else {
235         return oldValue.concat(this.objects());
236       }
237     }
238   });
239 
240   AV.Op._registerDecoder("Add", function(json) {
241     return new AV.Op.Add(AV._decode(undefined, json.objects));
242   });
243 
244   /**
245    * @class
246    * AddUnique is an atomic operation where the given items will be appended to
247    * the array that is stored in this field only if they were not already
248    * present in the array.
249    */
250   AV.Op.AddUnique = AV.Op._extend(
251       /** @lends AV.Op.AddUnique.prototype */ {
252 
253     _initialize: function(objects) {
254       this._objects = _.uniq(objects);
255     },
256 
257     /**
258      * Returns the objects to be added to the array.
259      * @return {Array} The objects to be added to the array.
260      */
261     objects: function() {
262       return this._objects;
263     },
264 
265     /**
266      * Returns a JSON version of the operation suitable for sending to AV.
267      * @return {Object}
268      */
269     toJSON: function() {
270       return { __op: "AddUnique", objects: AV._encode(this.objects()) };
271     },
272 
273     _mergeWithPrevious: function(previous) {
274       if (!previous) {
275         return this;
276       } else if (previous instanceof AV.Op.Unset) {
277         return new AV.Op.Set(this.objects());
278       } else if (previous instanceof AV.Op.Set) {
279         return new AV.Op.Set(this._estimate(previous.value()));
280       } else if (previous instanceof AV.Op.AddUnique) {
281         return new AV.Op.AddUnique(this._estimate(previous.objects()));
282       } else {
283         throw "Op is invalid after previous op.";
284       }
285     },
286 
287     _estimate: function(oldValue) {
288       if (!oldValue) {
289         return _.clone(this.objects());
290       } else {
291         // We can't just take the _.uniq(_.union(...)) of oldValue and
292         // this.objects, because the uniqueness may not apply to oldValue
293         // (especially if the oldValue was set via .set())
294         var newValue = _.clone(oldValue);
295         AV._arrayEach(this.objects(), function(obj) {
296           if (obj instanceof AV.Object && obj.id) {
297             var matchingObj = _.find(newValue, function(anObj) {
298               return (anObj instanceof AV.Object) && (anObj.id === obj.id);
299             });
300             if (!matchingObj) {
301               newValue.push(obj);
302             } else {
303               var index = _.indexOf(newValue, matchingObj);
304               newValue[index] = obj;
305             }
306           } else if (!_.contains(newValue, obj)) {
307             newValue.push(obj);
308           }
309         });
310         return newValue;
311       }
312     }
313   });
314 
315   AV.Op._registerDecoder("AddUnique", function(json) {
316     return new AV.Op.AddUnique(AV._decode(undefined, json.objects));
317   });
318 
319   /**
320    * @class
321    * Remove is an atomic operation where the given objects will be removed from
322    * the array that is stored in this field.
323    */
324   AV.Op.Remove = AV.Op._extend(/** @lends AV.Op.Remove.prototype */ {
325     _initialize: function(objects) {
326       this._objects = _.uniq(objects);
327     },
328 
329     /**
330      * Returns the objects to be removed from the array.
331      * @return {Array} The objects to be removed from the array.
332      */
333     objects: function() {
334       return this._objects;
335     },
336 
337     /**
338      * Returns a JSON version of the operation suitable for sending to AV.
339      * @return {Object}
340      */
341     toJSON: function() {
342       return { __op: "Remove", objects: AV._encode(this.objects()) };
343     },
344 
345     _mergeWithPrevious: function(previous) {
346       if (!previous) {
347         return this;
348       } else if (previous instanceof AV.Op.Unset) {
349         return previous;
350       } else if (previous instanceof AV.Op.Set) {
351         return new AV.Op.Set(this._estimate(previous.value()));
352       } else if (previous instanceof AV.Op.Remove) {
353         return new AV.Op.Remove(_.union(previous.objects(), this.objects()));
354       } else {
355         throw "Op is invalid after previous op.";
356       }
357     },
358 
359     _estimate: function(oldValue) {
360       if (!oldValue) {
361         return [];
362       } else {
363         var newValue = _.difference(oldValue, this.objects());
364         // If there are saved AV Objects being removed, also remove them.
365         AV._arrayEach(this.objects(), function(obj) {
366           if (obj instanceof AV.Object && obj.id) {
367             newValue = _.reject(newValue, function(other) {
368               return (other instanceof AV.Object) && (other.id === obj.id);
369             });
370           }
371         });
372         return newValue;
373       }
374     }
375   });
376 
377   AV.Op._registerDecoder("Remove", function(json) {
378     return new AV.Op.Remove(AV._decode(undefined, json.objects));
379   });
380 
381   /**
382    * @class
383    * A Relation operation indicates that the field is an instance of
384    * AV.Relation, and objects are being added to, or removed from, that
385    * relation.
386    */
387   AV.Op.Relation = AV.Op._extend(
388       /** @lends AV.Op.Relation.prototype */ {
389 
390     _initialize: function(adds, removes) {
391       this._targetClassName = null;
392 
393       var self = this;
394 
395       var pointerToId = function(object) {
396         if (object instanceof AV.Object) {
397           if (!object.id) {
398             throw "You can't add an unsaved AV.Object to a relation.";
399           }
400           if (!self._targetClassName) {
401             self._targetClassName = object.className;
402           }
403           if (self._targetClassName !== object.className) {
404             throw "Tried to create a AV.Relation with 2 different types: " +
405                   self._targetClassName + " and " + object.className + ".";
406           }
407           return object.id;
408         }
409         return object;
410       };
411 
412       this.relationsToAdd = _.uniq(_.map(adds, pointerToId));
413       this.relationsToRemove = _.uniq(_.map(removes, pointerToId));
414     },
415 
416     /**
417      * Returns an array of unfetched AV.Object that are being added to the
418      * relation.
419      * @return {Array}
420      */
421     added: function() {
422       var self = this;
423       return _.map(this.relationsToAdd, function(objectId) {
424         var object = AV.Object._create(self._targetClassName);
425         object.id = objectId;
426         return object;
427       });
428     },
429 
430     /**
431      * Returns an array of unfetched AV.Object that are being removed from
432      * the relation.
433      * @return {Array}
434      */
435     removed: function() {
436       var self = this;
437       return _.map(this.relationsToRemove, function(objectId) {
438         var object = AV.Object._create(self._targetClassName);
439         object.id = objectId;
440         return object;
441       });
442     },
443 
444     /**
445      * Returns a JSON version of the operation suitable for sending to AV.
446      * @return {Object}
447      */
448     toJSON: function() {
449       var adds = null;
450       var removes = null;
451       var self = this;
452       var idToPointer = function(id) {
453         return { __type: 'Pointer',
454                  className: self._targetClassName,
455                  objectId: id };
456       };
457       var pointers = null;
458       if (this.relationsToAdd.length > 0) {
459         pointers = _.map(this.relationsToAdd, idToPointer);
460         adds = { "__op": "AddRelation", "objects": pointers };
461       }
462 
463       if (this.relationsToRemove.length > 0) {
464         pointers = _.map(this.relationsToRemove, idToPointer);
465         removes = { "__op": "RemoveRelation", "objects": pointers };
466       }
467 
468       if (adds && removes) {
469         return { "__op": "Batch", "ops": [adds, removes]};
470       }
471 
472       return adds || removes || {};
473     },
474 
475     _mergeWithPrevious: function(previous) {
476       if (!previous) {
477         return this;
478       } else if (previous instanceof AV.Op.Unset) {
479         throw "You can't modify a relation after deleting it.";
480       } else if (previous instanceof AV.Op.Relation) {
481         if (previous._targetClassName &&
482             previous._targetClassName !== this._targetClassName) {
483           throw "Related object must be of class " + previous._targetClassName +
484               ", but " + this._targetClassName + " was passed in.";
485         }
486         var newAdd = _.union(_.difference(previous.relationsToAdd,
487                                           this.relationsToRemove),
488                              this.relationsToAdd);
489         var newRemove = _.union(_.difference(previous.relationsToRemove,
490                                              this.relationsToAdd),
491                                 this.relationsToRemove);
492 
493         var newRelation = new AV.Op.Relation(newAdd, newRemove);
494         newRelation._targetClassName = this._targetClassName;
495         return newRelation;
496       } else {
497         throw "Op is invalid after previous op.";
498       }
499     },
500 
501     _estimate: function(oldValue, object, key) {
502       if (!oldValue) {
503         var relation = new AV.Relation(object, key);
504         relation.targetClassName = this._targetClassName;
505       } else if (oldValue instanceof AV.Relation) {
506         if (this._targetClassName) {
507           if (oldValue.targetClassName) {
508             if (oldValue.targetClassName !== this._targetClassName) {
509               throw "Related object must be a " + oldValue.targetClassName +
510                   ", but a " + this._targetClassName + " was passed in.";
511             }
512           } else {
513             oldValue.targetClassName = this._targetClassName;
514           }
515         }
516         return oldValue;
517       } else {
518         throw "Op is invalid after previous op.";
519       }
520     }
521   });
522 
523   AV.Op._registerDecoder("AddRelation", function(json) {
524     return new AV.Op.Relation(AV._decode(undefined, json.objects), []);
525   });
526   AV.Op._registerDecoder("RemoveRelation", function(json) {
527     return new AV.Op.Relation([], AV._decode(undefined, json.objects));
528   });
529 
530 };
531
